intro: Securidaca obcordata, commonly known as the African senna, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in dry, open woodlands and savannas. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread across its native habitat.
